text:
“Why are you afraid?” the man asked, laughing.

Raskolnikov whispered, “Ach, hang it!” He loathed the thought.

He stood, then sat again, despair washing over him.

“You’ve lost faith,” the man continued. “You created a theory. It failed. But you’re not hopelessly base. You went straight to the end.”

Raskolnikov frowned.

“Find faith,” the man urged. “You need a change. Suffering can be good. Don’t hesitate. Jump into life. Trust the flood will carry you.”

Raskolnikov listened, doubt lingering in his eyes.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is urged to confess and embrace suffering as a path to finding faith and meaning in life.
